column4: my ubuntu 10.04 livecd is stuck on the purple screen where the dots fill in to load and wont actually boot the cd
Did you verify the image and run the cd check utility?
i did verify the image
I had a computer behave the same way before it died. Now it can only stay running for about 60 seconds before it freezes
that's promising haha. i just bought this one used.
Have you tried installing with an alternate cd? Did you run the cd verification program?
i tried about  6 cds so far haha some 10.10 some 10.04
and?
same result with all of them respective to their individual issues
Oh that's not good. nit-wit was asking if you can boot from a usb pen drive
I think it's either a bug (try (dis)connecting to the internet) or just a bad disk
ive tried disconnecting from the internet and three disks
And they all fail in the exact same place?
ypu
it also fails to boot 10.04 completely
Strange. Have you tried any other distro / OS?
everything worked great until earlier today and none of my programs would open so i went for a quick reboot and it wouldnt reboot properl
Sounds like it might be a hardware issue. The PSU is prime suspect followed by possible drive failure
i hope it isnt because i literally just bought it and everything was working just fine until a few hours ago
If you don't have any spare parts or another pc to test with, your only option might be a repair shop. But first, make sure to test other OS / distro to see
i dont really care enough about this computer to repair it honestly. i bought it very cheap to play with. ill try to install something else to get it working at least
DSL has a smaller footprint if I'm not mistaken
ill download it now then
